page.title: 17CROSSFIELD FARM
page.content: Crossfield farm is historical as it dates back to the eighteenth century.The last woman to hang at Taunton castle was a worker at Crossfields.She was convicted of murdering the farmer,who was her employer.Crossfield consisted of five small farms,but today only Crossfield and Roughmoor exist.Only one of these are occupied today.The farm has 277 acres,17 acres for cattle and 260 acres for cereals;They supply their oats to Quakers in London,the wheat goes to Dunball,the barley is kept for experimental feed stuff for cattle,oil seed rape for margerine.This is the first year of production,1985.The Dossons have held the farm since 1904.Today Mrs.Dosson,her two sons and one manual worker run the farm.The basic equipment is 5 tractors,1 combine harvester,1 manure spreader,
